definition: to award (a prize)/to confer on sb/to confer upon by authority
to promulgate/to send out/to issue/to grant or confer

sentences.english: The king conferred the dignity of a peerage on the general.
sentences.chinese: 国王颁赐爵位这要职给将军。

sentences.english: The emperors of past dynasties have imitated the example since the appearance of it in the Western Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 据文献记载，铁券出现于西汉，魏晋以降多有颁赐。

sentences.english: The greatest honor history can bestow is the title of peacemaker .
sentences.chinese: 历史所能颁赐的最大荣耀，就是和平缔造者这个头衔。

definition: to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward
to bestow a prize or reward/an award
to appoint sb to a post or confer a title on sb by imperial order
to be bestowed, conferred, or granted by the emperor
to seal up (a door with a paper seal, or a document)/to confer an additional title on a nobleman
to hand down an imperial edict
to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
